entries.meaning: (linguistics) An affix consisting of a prefix and suffix affixed simultaneously to the root
(linguistics, rare) An affix which is not divided, and which does not divide a root: thus, a prefix, suffix, or interfix

verbs.description: confix (third-person singular simple present confixes, present participle confixing, simple past and past participle confixed)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To make firm; to fix in a particular place or state
